post_text: On November 7, 2019 Ms. Young, Guidance Intern Ms. Stoner and a group of high school students traveled to the World Vision Global Distribution Center to volunteer their time and services. This is an organization that receives high-quality donated products, such as clothes, shoes, medical and school supplies, personal care items, and other needed items for children and families in need. The items are distributed to families throughout the United States and internationally. Our students sorted, folded and packed items in boxes for shipping. to support the mission of World Vision.

post_text: Congratulations to the team of Quintin Lint, Eddie Yorns, Gabe Haddox and Parker Kauffman who competed in an engineering competition sponsored by Shell and the Pittsburgh Steelers on Monday, October 28, 2019 at the BVIU. This NB team is one of two finalists moving on to represent Beaver County at the finals on Tuesday November 19 at Heinz Field. They will be competing against high school engineering teams from Allegheny and Washington Counties. Students were challenged to power Pittsburgh or Heinz Field. The team's design focuses on wellness and an alternative power source (bicycle power) to power Heinz Field. Congratulations!

post_text: Students from the middle school attended the Buddy Walk on Saturday, October 19th at the Highmark Stadium in Pittsburgh. The Buddy Walk supports individuals with Down Syndrome and their families and helps them build community. Students at the middle school decided this was something they wanted to participate in to build an understanding of differences and to support inclusion. The Down Syndrome Association of Pittsburgh organized the Buddy Walk and proceeds are donated to the Down Syndrome Center of Pittsburgh at UPMC Children Hospital. If you would like to donate to our team please click the following link: https://www.classy.org/team/256982
